intro: Skiatophytum, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species known for their latex-like sap. Skiatophytum is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with deep root systems and minimal water requirements. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, playing a role in local ecosystems.
